definitions.definition: a condition of body and mind such as that which typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is relatively inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.
examples: I was on the verge of sleep
synonyms: power nap; literaryslumber "go and have a sleep"

definitions.definition: a state compared to or resembling sleep, such as death or complete silence or stillness.
examples: a photograph of the poet in his last sleep

definitions.definition: a gummy or gritty secretion found in the corners of the eyes after sleep.
examples: she sat up, rubbing the sleep from her eyes
she slept for half an hour
synonyms: catch some Zs; humorousbe in the land of Nod
be in the arms of Morpheus; literaryslumber "she slept for about an hour"

examples: Copenhagen likes to be known as the city that never sleeps

definitions.definition: be at peace in death; lie buried.
examples: he sleeps beneath the silver birches

definitions.definition: provide (a specified number of people) with beds, rooms, or places to stay the night.
examples: studios sleeping two people cost $70 a night

definitions.definition: have sexual intercourse or be involved in a sexual relationship.
examples: I won't sleep with a man who doesn't respect me
